import React, { useState } from "react"; import { useParams, Link } from "react-router-dom"; import { FaBed, FaBath, FaCar, FaShieldAlt, FaComments, FaPhone, FaShareAlt } from "react-icons/fa"; // Sample property data const properties = [ { id: 1, title: "Luxury 2 BHK Apartment", price: "$120,000", location: "Delhi, India", description: "Spacious 2 BHK apartment with modern amenities, fully furnished, located in prime area with excellent connectivity.", beds: 2, baths: 2, parking: 1, security: "24/7", classification: "Premium", image: "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1600585154340-be6161a56a0c", seller: { name: "Amit Sharma", avatar: "https://i.ibb.co/3mT9xzw/user1.png", date: "12 Jan 2025", }, }, { id: 2, title: "Family House", price: "$180,000", location: "Mumbai, India", description: "Cozy family house with large garden and parking. Ideal for families looking for comfort and security.", beds: 3, baths: 2, parking: 2, security: "24/7", classification: "Standard", image: "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1600607688969-a5bfcd646154", seller: { name: "Shruti Patel", avatar: "https://i.ibb.co/7rnSKkj/user3.png", date: "03 Feb 2025", }, }, ]; export default function PropertiesDetails() { const { id } = useParams(); const property = properties.find((p) => p.id === parseInt(id)); const [openModal, setOpenModal] = useState(false); if (!property) return
